intro: Sinojackia xylocarpa var. leshanensis, commonly known as the Leshan sinowood, is a rare and woody shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rhoipteleaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clustered yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. It is typically found in subtropical forests and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
